meanings.definition: To come together to form one mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The clouds were coalescing into a dark storm overhead.
meanings.sent2: The ingredients in the recipe were coalescing into a delicious soup.
meanings.sent3: The students were coalescing around the teacher, eager to hear the exciting news.
meanings.sent4: The ideas were coalescing in her mind, creating a brilliant solution.
meanings.sent5: The colors were coalescing on the canvas, forming a beautiful painting.

meanings.definition: To unite or merge into a single body or group.
meanings.sent1: The two companies were coalescing to create a stronger partnership.
meanings.sent2: The rivers were coalescing into a mighty stream.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were coalescing together effortlessly, much to the delight of the child.
meanings.sent4: The voices of the choir were coalescing into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The dancers were coalescing on stage, moving as one in perfect synchronization.
